Package org.soen6441.model.orders

Class Negotiate

java.lang.Object
org.soen6441.model.orders.Negotiate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Order
public class Negotiate
extends java.lang.Object
implements Order
Negotiate class implements the Order interface and overrides the execute method. During IssueOrder phase, when player issues negotiate command, it is stored in the orders list. During the ExecuteOrder phase, execute method of this class is called.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Player d_SourcePlayer
    The source player is the negotiate order issuing player, the target player is the player with whom the deal is struck.

    The source player is the negotiate order issuing player, the target player is the player with whom the deal is struck.

  • Constructor Details

    • Negotiate

      public Negotiate​(Player p_SourcePlayer, Player p_TargetPlayer)
      Constructor of the Negotiate class which is called when object is created.
      Parameters:
      p_SourcePlayer - The player who issues the negotiate command.
      p_TargetPlayer - The Player with whom source player wants to have a negotiation.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      This method adds the logic for the diplomacy(negotiation). If the source player owns Negotiate Card, then this method will make sure source and target players can not attack on each other during the turn. This method also removes the Negotiate Card from the source player so that he can not use it again.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Order

    • getSourcePlayer

      public Player getSourcePlayer()
      This method returns the source player who issues the Negotiate order.
      Returns:
      Player who issued the negotiate command.

    • setSourcePlayer

      public void setSourcePlayer​(Player d_SourcePlayer)
      This method sets the player who issues the Negotiate order.
      Parameters:
      d_SourcePlayer - Player who issues the negotiate order.
